alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Rutherford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 5:23PM EST until November 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northeastern Henderson County and western Rutherford County in North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams including campgrounds, greenways, parks, boat-access areas, farmland, low-water crossings, and low-lying secondary roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM EST, Heavy rainfall has departed the area and only light rainfall will impact the Chimney Rock and Lake Lure area through the remainder of the evening. However, storm- total rainfall of 3-4" occurred along the headwaters of the Broad River from Gerton to Chimney Rock to Lake Lure since early Friday morning, causing significant rises along the Broad/Rocky Broad River and associated tributaries. While the flash flood threat has ended, the Broad River near Lake Lure continues to run above bankfull in some areas, causing nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying areas. Therefore, a Flood Advisory has been issued from Bat Cave to Lake Lure to Green Hill and will remain in effect until floodwaters have receded. - Some locations that may continue to experience flooding include... Chimney Rock Village, Bat Cave, and areas downstream of Lake Lure. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
